library(gt)
library(epoxy)

# Create a data frame with three columns
data <- data.frame(
  Title = c("EDITOR", "ASSOCIATE EDITOR", "STUDENT ASSISTANT EDITOR", "CONTENT EDITORS–RESEARCH BRIEFS"),
  Name = c("Meg Ternes", "Leah Georges", "Sarah Shaw", "Kelly McWilliams"),
  Email = c("meg.ternes@smu.ca", "leahgeorges@creighton.edu", "sarah.shaw@smu.ca", "kmcwilliams@jjay.cuny.edu")
)

titles <- c("EDITOR", "ASSOCIATE EDITOR", "STUDENT ASSISTANT EDITOR", "CONTENT EDITORS–RESEARCH BRIEFS", "CONTENT EDITOR-LEGAL UPDATE", "CONTENT EDITOR-TEACHING IN PSYCH & LAW", "CONTENT EDITOR-CAREER CORNER", "CONTENT EDITOR-CLINICAL & FORENSIC PRACTICE")
names <- c("Meg Ternes", "Leah Georges", "Sarah Shaw", "Kelly McWilliams", "Veronica Johnson", "Lori Hoetger", "Casey LaDuke", "Kamar Tazi", "Danielle Rynczak")
emails <- c("meg.ternes@smu.ca", "leahgeorges@creighton.edu", "sarah.shaw@smu.ca", "kmcwilliams@jjay.cuny.edu", "vjohnson@jjay.cuny.edu", "lhoetger@gmail.com", "ttc@ap-ls.org", "aplsstudent@gmail.com", "danielle.rynczak@umassmed.edu")


# Use epoxy to paste the title, name, and email together
epoxy_html(
  "{Title}\n{Name}\n{Email}")

# Create the table using gt
my_table <- data |> 
  select(CombinedInfo)  |>   # Select only the CombinedInfo column
  gt()

# Apply styling to center the text in all cells
my_table <- my_table |> 
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text_align("center"),  # Center the text
    locations = everything()  # Target all columns
  )

# Print the table
my_table
